Objects¶

SquareObject¶

class pyroborobo.SquareObject¶
Attributes
id

the id of the object

soft_height

the height of the soft part of the object (can be walked on)

soft_width

the width of the soft part of the object (can be walked on)

solid_height

the height of the solid part of the object

solid_width

the width of the solid part of the object

Methods

can_register(self)

Can the object be registered at its current location

hide(self)

hide the object from the screen (collision is still active)

is_pushed(self, id, force, float])

Callback when the object is pushed

is_touched(self, id)

Callback when the object is touched

is_walked(self, id)

Callback when the object is walked on

register(self)

Register the object (activate collision)

relocate(*args, **kwargs)

Overloaded function.

set_color(self, red, blue, green)

set the (r,g,b) color for the object

set_coordinates(self, x, y)

force the object to be at the (x,y) coordinates without checking

show(self)

show the object from the screen (collision is still inactive)

step(self)

Call at each timestep

unregister(self)

Unregister the object (deactivate collision)

Callback when the object is walked on

Register the object (activate collision)

relocate(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. relocate(self: _pyroborobo.SquareObject) -> None

Find a new position for the object

  1. relocate(self: _pyroborobo.SquareObject, x: int, y: int) -> bool

Place the object at the (x,y) coordinates. Return if succeed or not

set_color(self: _pyroborobo.SquareObject, red: int, blue: int, green: int) → None¶

Overloaded function.

  1. relocate(self: _pyroborobo.CircleObject) -> None

Place the object at a random location

  1. relocate(self: _pyroborobo.CircleObject, x: int, y: int) -> bool

Place the object at the (x,y) coordinates. Return False if impossible
